text: [Music]
hey guys good morning today I'm doing
something a bit different in my video we
are going to be making a slow cooker
braised pork belly and I have my slow
cooker behind me and basically I'm in
put all the ingredients into the slow
cooker this morning and then I'm going
to go out and about my day and come back
a couple hours and show you what it
looks like when it's done and if you're
wondering this is based off of my
braised pork belly recipe video that I
did a couple years ago but this one is
in a slow cooker and it's made
specifically for a slow cooker so if you
guys like braised pork belly and you
like slow cooker recipes keep watching
first start with your pork belly I'm
using about two pounds of boneless pork
belly here and you'll want to cut those
into large or small pieces depending on
how you like it today I'm going to do
about one and a half inch pieces
just note that they will shrink of it
after kicking next in a preheated pan
I'm going to lightly Brown the pork for
a few minutes before placing the pieces
into the slow cooker now that was the
hardest part of today's cooking the rest
is super easy after placing the fork
into a slow cooker add in the other
ingredients 2 tablespoons of minced
garlic 2 tablespoons of brown sugar or
rock sugar 8 tablespoons or half a cup
of light soy sauce 2 tablespoons of rice
wine 3 tablespoons of dried shallots
half a teaspoon of white pepper 1
teaspoon of salt and one teaspoon of
five-spice powder so this is how my
grandma makes her pork belly she only
uses one type of soy sauce which is the
regular soy sauce or light soy sauce but
I'm going to modify it and I'm going to
add two tablespoons of dark soy sauce
and I'm adding this because this is
going to give us a more deeper caramel
color to the pork and also because it
makes it taste more savory once all
those ingredients are measured out add
enough water to just cover the pork I'm
using about 4 cups of water here but
it's totally ok to use more if needed
then cover and set your slow cooker to
cook on high for 6 hours now totally
optional halfway through I'm going to
make some medium boiled eggs in my egg
cooker peel the shells then gently add
them to the liquid this will allow them
to soak up the flavors of the braising
liquid to make savory soy sauce eggs and
at this time you can also add things
like bamboo shoots which my grandma
really likes to add in hers but I didn't
have any on hand for today's video and
off to the side while I'm waiting for my
slow cooker I'm going to make some
specialize in my rice cooker after 6
hours your pork belly should look like
this the meat should be extremely tender
and the braising liquid a bit thicker
and slightly glossy and that is how you
know it's done
I recommend serving a few pieces of the
pork belly over hot rice and spooning a
bit of the braising liquid over that
then finally add half of a soy sauce egg
[Music]
and that is how you make braised pork
belly in a slow cooker my kitchen smells
so good right now it smells like
five-spice and I'm probably going to
have to air it out later before I go to
bed but for now it's really really good
now for the taste test and my early
dinner we've got a bowl right here to
try a piece of the pork that tastes
amazing
it's literally melted in my mouth so
buttery mmm so good one more thing is
after you're done you'll have a ton of
braising liquid left over I want you to
keep that put it in the fridge
refrigerate it use it again for another
slab of pork belly or you could freeze
it and save it for my next recipe which
I'm going to be doing soon and if you
guys want to see what that is check out
my patreon page
I have previous clips from my patreon
supporters I hope you guys like this
video recipe and also kind of a new
casual video format I have a new camera
that I'm using so it might look slightly
different but hopefully still good on
your end give me a thumbs up if you
liked this video and I will see you in
the next one bye for now
